text: Hey, i am very new in HubSpot. Is there any plugin that i can use to integrate star rating reviews in HubSpot? i have a page dynamic page that i want to integrate a star reviews rating on every page. is this possible?
Is there any way to trigger a window alert on a form submit?

There are several jQuery/Js Plugins out there, with different styling options. For Example: <https://rating-widget.com/get/rating/javascript/#editor> I created just for fun an API function that use forms, webhooks and HubDB to create a star rating system. But it is a mess if you can get it simply with jQuery.
<@U011YHRTQDT> Use Global Form Events: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/global-form-events>

Thanks <@UK9BKNBD5> i will check the script out.

I have another big issue that i can’t figure out is it possible to use different templates for index and dynamic page? for an example i want to use one template for /cars and another one for /cars/toyota. is this possible? i cant find any reference at all
Because if i use one template like the membership site tutorial, i cant use the editor for the modules in the dynamic pages...  it is so confusing. Any ideas??

Hem, I get what you mean. But this is not how dynamic pages work. You can only have one template for all dyn-pages. Feel free to create an _if/else_ expression test on your HubDB row with the categories information and based on that property _include_ a different partial.
I understand, so its best to have no changeable content from the editor on the dynamic pages. Ill just make static modules and thats it
Thanks alot Mitja!!!
In case of your modules the fields values has to be from your HubDB and has to get applied over you template file, It can't be set by the editor. It has to be set in the database.

Hello all
I've just joined this channel - what a great way to collaborate.
We've just added a HubSpot form to a website and I would like to remove the black outline on the checkboxes. Is this possible? I've been told that it is a default box on HubSpot so not possible to change.

Welcome, <@U020SSLDR1U>! I'm new to HubSpot's Slack too, but have been working on the platform for several years. You can disable the default form styles which will allow you to use your own CSS to style the checkboxes. In HubSpot, edit the form in question then follow these steps:
1. Go to *Style & Preview tab*
2. Toggle *Set as raw HTML form* to on
3. Use custom CSS to to style the checkboxes
Thank you very much!! Really appreciate it.
Sure thing! Custom CSS checkboxes are tricky, btw. There are lots of examples here: <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4148499/how-to-style-a-checkbox-using-css>
Anyone out there have some examples of great calculators with a nice user experience?
As a heads-up that toggle will remove pretty much all of the form's styles.
<https://www.homee.com/homeowners/cost-calculator>
I like it. It’s keyboard accessible too
is there a HubSpot cache file I can clear somewhere? Especially related to themes? Despite deleting and re-naming my theme in every way I can imagine it keeps coming back with the same name...
can you paste your theme.json file?
the folder ends up being named `brand-theme`
which is an older name
weird, in the page editor it should show up as Brand Boil
in the design manager folder it shows up as "brand-theme"
the page editor...one sec
is correct
the issue is just in the design manager
hmm, not entirely certain I’m on the same page then. When you rename the folder itself it should just rename it. Can you DM me a link to the theme folder in the Design Manager? I’ll take a look
sent, thanks

Not sure wheee to post this so many chnnaels,  but I am having trouble converting Unix code from hubDB to readable date time. I tried multiple by 1000, new Date() constructor and then localestring,  but the dates are wacky.

Then omitted the 1000 part, it came pretty close but it’s a day off and the start time is off as well

Further context I am trying to filter out events on a 30 day time frame. Just having trouble accessing the correct date via Unix. I think as long as dates aren’t close together I might can get away with it but off by 1 is a large margin if events are close to another
